creator: nuno.ponte@multicert.com
text:
If a build.xml file has an import statement and the file is not found, the
execution fails, even if it is invoked with the -keep-going (-k) ant switch.

  This annoying in cases where the file to be imported is not present and is nor
important (e.g., if you have a base build file and want to perform the initial
checkout). Besides, it's not consistent with the behaviour documented for -k:

      "execute all targets that do not depend on failed target(s)"

<import> is used in the default (nameless) target that is always executed.  So all targets depend on it.  
Thus saying this breaks keepgoing behavior is a fallacy.  If you want optional <import>s, try setting 
<import>'s _documented_ 'optional' attribute to "true", "yes", or "on".
